from pprint import pprint
import os
import sys
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
from time import time, sleep
import json
from datetime import datetime
import warnings
from collections import defaultdict, Counter
import plotly.express as px
import plotly.graph_objects as go
source.384f305e:
with open("leaderboard.json") as f:
    jsn = json.load(f)
source.81b09bed:
scores = []
tiers = []
medals = []
entries = []
teams = []
for user in jsn['beforeUser']+jsn['afterUser']:
    for teammember in user['teamMembers']:
        tiers.append(teammember['tier'])
    scores.append(user['score'])
    medals.append(user['medal'])
    entries.append(user['entries'])
    teams.append(user['teamName'])
source.716fd8c5:
best_ten = score_df.iloc[0:15]
fig = px.bar(best_ten.iloc[::-1], x='Public Score', y='Team',
              color='Public Score',height=700, title='Top 15 Teams (With Public Score)',text='Public Score')
fig.show()
source.564f39b8:
fig = px.bar(score_df.iloc[::-1], x='Public Score', y='Team',
              color='Public Score',height=4000, title='Top 100 Teams (With Public Score)',text='Public Score')
fig.show()
source.3d1d05b7:
rank = 1
rank_list = []
gold_teams = []
for i,j in zip(medals,teams):
    if i == 'gold':
        rank_list.append(rank)
        gold_teams.append(j)
        rank += 1
source.97895c8d:
fig = go.Figure(data=[go.Table(
    header=dict(values=['Rank','Team'],
                fill_color='paleturquoise',
                line_color='blue',
                align='left'),
    cells=dict(values=[rank_list,gold_teams],
               fill_color='lavender',
               align='left'))
])
fig.update_layout(title='Gold Medal Zone')
fig.show()

source.1f8f034b:
ranks = []
for i in range(423):
    ranks.append(i+1)
fig = go.Figure(data=[go.Bar(
            x=ranks, y=entries
        )])
fig.update_layout(title_text='Entries in the Medal Zone',xaxis_title="Rank",yaxis_title='Entries')
fig.show()
source.1dcabebb:
# Jane Street:Public Leaderboard Visualization (23/02/2021)



* This competition was launched about two months ago and it may be too late to write leaderboard notebook, but I'll try to update every day until this competition ends...
* For getting leaderboard information, I referred [this notebook](https://www.kaggle.com/nagiss/santa2020-leaderboard-analysis).
* If you like, please feel free to **upvote**!
